title: config: Parser respresents multiple entries as tuples, which callers don't handle
body:
If a value occurs multiple times in the git configuration, it's represented as a tuple.

https://github.com/datalad/datalad/blob/1bdc37a5ec2e8d63bba541e7c9c0778b4559fd89/datalad/config.py#L79-L85

AFAICS most, if not all, callers of `config.get` and friends do not handle this multi-value case. This means that I can't set a value in `.gitconfig` and then override it in the repo's `.git/config` (e.g., if I want to enable `datalad.run.record-sidecar` in general, but disable it in a specific repo).

---

```bash
#!/bin/sh
set -e

mkdir -p /tmp/dl/
export HOME=/tmp/dl/

git config --global user.name "blah"
git config --global user.email "blah@blah"

repo=/tmp/dl/config-test

test -e $repo && datalad remove --nocheck $repo

datalad create $repo

cd $repo
git config --global datalad.run.record-sidecar true
git config datalad.run.record-sidecar false

pycmd=$(tr "\n" " " <<-EOF
        from datalad.api import Dataset;
        d = Dataset('.');
        print(d.config.get('datalad.run.record-sidecar'));
        print(d.config.getbool('datalad', 'run.record-sidecar'))
EOF
)

python -c "$pycmd"
```

```
remove(ok): /tmp/dl/config-test (dataset)
[INFO   ] Creating a new annex repo at /tmp/dl/config-test
create(ok): /tmp/dl/config-test (dataset)
('true', 'false')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<string>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/home/kyle/src/python/datalad/datalad/config.py", line 473, in getbool
    return anything2bool(val)
  File "/home/kyle/src/python/datalad/datalad/config.py", line 113, in anything2bool
    % repr(val))
TypeError: Got value ('true', 'false') which could not be interpreted as a boolean
```
